intro: Hypobathrum lancifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hypobathrum, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are small and yellow, often forming a cluster at the top of the plant. Hypobathrum lancifolium is adapted to grow in dry, open habitats and is often found in grasslands or rocky areas.
